title: MSM: Whole body scale
documentation:
This workspace contains the current state of the whole-body systems physiology model used to demonstrate the capabilities of the SPARC Functional Connectivity map interface. It is the whole-body scale component to the multiscale model exemplar.
The coreresponding map sources are part of the repository available on Github at https://github.com/AnatomicMaps/CVS-functional-model.
description: This workspace captures the current state of the whole-body systems physiology model used to demonstrate the capabilities of the SPARC Functional Connectivity map interface. It is the whole-body scale component to the multiscale model exemplar.

title: MSM: Tissue scale
documentation:
This workspace contains the current state of the multiscale whole-body systems physiology model used to demonstrate the capabilities of the SPARC Functional Connectivity map interface. It is the tissue scale component to the multiscale model exemplar.
The coreresponding map sources are part of the repository available on Github at https://github.com/AnatomicMaps/CVS-functional-model.
description: This workspace captures the current state of the tissue (FTU) model used to demonstrate the capabilities of the SPARC Functional Connectivity map interface. It is the tissue scale component to the multiscale model exemplar.

title: MSM: Cellular scale
documentation:
This workspace contains the current state of the multiscale whole-body systems physiology model used to demonstrate the capabilities of the SPARC Functional Connectivity map interface. It is the cellular scale component to the multiscale model exemplar.
The coreresponding map sources are part of the repository available on Github at https://github.com/AnatomicMaps/CVS-functional-model.
description: This workspace captures the current state of the cellular model used to demonstrate the capabilities of the SPARC Functional Connectivity map interface. It is the cellular scale component to the multiscale model exemplar.

title: MSM: Blood pressure control
documentation:
This workspace contains the current state of the multiscale whole-body systems physiology model used to demonstrate the capabilities of the SPARC Functional Connectivity map interface. This is an example blood pressure control component to the multiscale model exemplar.
The coreresponding map sources are part of the repository available on Github at https://github.com/AnatomicMaps/CVS-functional-model.
description: This workspace captures the current state of the blood pressure control model used to demonstrate the capabilities of the SPARC Functional Connectivity map interface. It is an example control component to the multiscale model exemplar.

title: Blood volume control model
documentation: A simple model of the control of blood volume by sodium. Shown below, the three compartments (GI tract, kidney, and circulation system) are shown with grey backgrounds. The blue-background rectangular boxes indicate the 6-layer FTUs (Functional Tissue Units) that encompass exchange of substances (in this case just water and sodium) between the epithelial compartments and blood. The 0:nodes and 1:nodes provide the link to protein mechanisms in subcellular compartments. The variables shown in red are specified boundary conditions.
description: A simple model of the control of blood volume by sodium.
